ProfessionalSummary:
➢ Skype: led a team of 30 analysts, data scientists, data & dashboard engineers across the UK, US & India to provide
product & market intelligence to business leaders to help propel Skype to 1bn users & $8.5bn acquisition by Microsoft.
Specific responsibilities were centred around product experimentation, power BI dashboard roll out, data platform
architecture & build, deep learning and predictive data science modelling which were all channelled through an operating
rhythm and reporting structure which enabled business stakeholders to connect with insights and learnings.

➢ KNEIP: led a €3m euro investment (over 3 years) in upgrading KNEIP's, a financial services company in Luxembourg,
Data and Analytics capabilities as part of a broader strategy to transform the business to be a SaaS provider and improve
the company valuation by more than 10X. Specific responsibilities were to build and initially lead a BI team, tooling
capability (solved by Qlik) and lead market, customer and business analytics to gear the business for a new waive of
growth in an increasingly Digital Market.
➢ Boardroom Media: led a number of analytical projects for this Australian based Media Company to help extract
learnings from the current client base and shape future growth strategies. Specifically, projects included UK/US/APAC
market analysis, competitive positioning, pricing, marketing and optimisation of the acquisition funnel along with
customer engagement and churn triggers from within the existing client base.

➢ NW/A: led, as a Managing Partner and Deputy CEO of this Digital Investment and Transformation company, commercial
analysis on a number (25, in 4 years) of investment opportunities that led to the more than 10 investments, of ~£10m in
value, being secured predominantly the ESG, Food Tech or Media industries. Investments have been onwardly
supported with strategic input to help shape growth strategies and yield returns for the overall NW/A portfolio.

EducationDetails.Text:
•   Maths A Level/Business GNVQ (total 3.5 A-levels)
•   Gravitas Executive Level Senior Leadership Coaching Programme
•   SQL and Excel for Data Analysis
•   Tableau and Power BI Data Visualisation Packages
•   "Mastering Big Data" Programme
•   Wharton's Business Analytics via University of Pennsylvania
•   SITEL Contact Centre Management Qualification

Positions.Description:
(which ended abruptly due to the business suffering a funding collapse in 2017) a successful consultancy business was formed solving Data and Analytical needs for a number of clients
across the UK and ROW, highlights as follows;

KNEIP - a Financial Services business based in Luxembourg undertaking a Digital Transformation to be a
modern-day SaaS solution,

•	Led a €3m investment in building KNEIPs Data & Analytics capabilities as part of a full business SaaS transformation
•	Built, trained, & provided interim leadership to a BI Team of 1 Head of, 4 analysts and 2 Data Engineers
•	Deployed Qliksense as the business BI solution used by over 300 employees averaging 15 visits per month
•	Completed multiple analytical studies on KNEIPs client journey from acquisition to churn to identify and prioritise the investment of a ~€30m Digital Transformation budget
•	Designed & embedded a reporting rhythm that put data at the heart of decision making with the C-suite/KNEIP Board
•	Embedded ESAT(Peakon) and NPS (Delighted) tooling as part of an agile way of working
•	Led analytics on product experimentation cycles to learn from a mixture of A/B and Time-Based testing and determine
product investment priorities.
•	Transformed the performance management culture from a once-a-year annual review cycle to an agile quarterly check
in which highly pivoted around data driven conversations - resulting in a dramatic shift on the performance bell curve.

Positions.JobLevel: Senior Manager (more than 5 years management experience)
Positions.Description:
Led Skype's global data team to develop a high-speed learning culture for Product and
Engineering, building a data platform that allowed quick and easy access to rich insights, a data/metric led methodology to investment cycles, executive level performance tracking and reporting, all helping propel Skype to 1 billion users.

Key Achievements
•	Data Strategy: Built "Skype Analytics" a Power BI based data platform enabling 2000 employees access to a data set
that was ingesting 1 petabyte of data per day from the Skype user base
•	Business Analysis: Led analytical studies which changed Skypes investments in user experience; e.g. Skype's user
onboarding (200m users pa impacted) and Window migration (300m users impacted)
•   Microsoft Product Integration: ran predictive modelling/analysis to assess impact of Skypes integration to Microsoft's
product portfolio yielding a 250m growth in reachable users
•   Windows 10 Upgrade: ran significant A/B testing and predictive analytics to determine roll out and upgrade plan for
over 200m monthly users and 50m daily users on the Skype for Windows platform
•   Skype for Life: carried out extensive impact analysis/predictive modelling to top line KPIs, (Monthly Users, Calling Minutes, Revenue and Messaging) to migrate 700m yearly users on to Skypes next gen platform
•   Monthly Active Users: led the technical design, build and test for Skypes Monthly Active User metric which was pivotal
in the business performance articulation during IPO and onward $8.5bn sale to Microsoft.
•   Client Acquisition: led a multiple pieces of analytics to determine the happy path for acquiring and onboarding users,
through single identity sign up through the formation of early habit and sustainable usage patterns
•   Team Build: Built Skypes Data team of 30 FTE with both internal/3rd party resources across multiple locations including
Data and Dashboard Engineers, Analysts and Data Scientists.

JobTitle.Raw: Head of Business Insights & Planning, Skype Operations
JobTitle.Normalized: Head of Business Insights AND Planning Skype Operations
Variations: Head of Business Insights & Planning, Skype

Positions.Description:
Built out a Business Insights and Planning capability, in the operational division of Skype, creating a data/metric led
approach to planning and resourcing to grow a culture of high performance. Primary focus of operational delivery was
managing the "in-life" user experience to secure Gross Margin targets and increase NPS

Key Achievements
•   Business Analytics: Built and scaled user insight capability to provide "in-life" intelligence to Product and Engineering
teams; led to product changes yielding $5m revenue growth and 20m fewer churned users
•   Payment and Fraud: designed and rolled out payments and fraud (funnel) analytics to achieve greater control Skypes
rules engine vs revenue performance - optimisation led to €75m of additional revenue in a 3-year period
•   Skype and IBM: Led operational negotiations with IBM on a 5-year agreement to manage Skype Customer Service
business which achieved the following:
o   Saved $20million over the 5-year term in servicing cost v previous incumbent.
o   Increased CSAT by 20% enabled by 25% improvement in First Contact Resolution.
o   Lowered response times from 36 hours to 1 in email and 3mins to 15secs in chat.
•   Talent Development: Designed and led operational succession planning for future business leaders with a modular
programme covering Strategy, Alignment, Commercial, Customer and Personal leadership.

Joined the BT Consumer Repair services team with the responsibility to shape and promote the        proposition - part of a broader strategy to encourage users to "self-serve" vs requiring call centre support, ultimately reducing BT's servicing
cost and improving gross margin.

Key Achievements
•   Business Transformation: Increased customer transactions on        by 15000 per week through internal
promotion and functionality development - saving £2m a year.
•   Change Management: Changed IVR design enabling an additional 10000 customer contacts/week to self-serve -
saving £1m per year.

Member of the BT centralised planning team supporting the Customer Service Operations across several channels and
multiple global locations. With specific responsibility for Sales,    ~~~~~   and Business Repair (during tenure) role was to manage delivery of the operational plan that achieved each FY budget and service ambitions, and to manage all call centre
staffing/scheduling requirements for UK and Global outsource teams.
Key Achievements

•   Process Improvement: Improved CSAT in BTB call handling reducing abandonment from 6% to < 3%.
•   Budget Planning: Reduced Business Service Management operational costs by 20% (£10m).

QualificationsSummary:
Skills
Executive Leadership	Visionary leadership and skilled resource allocation to achieve all deliverables
Insights & Analytics	Highly skilled in directing data operations & customer analysis using analytical tools
Data Science	Develops predictive and prescriptive models powering business insights
Data Strategy	Defines and directs implementation of innovative and successful data strategies
Market Sizing	Expert in sizing market opportunities and headroom for growth potential
Client Acquisition	Builds marketing funnels and optimisation insights to maximise acquisition
Client Experience	Analyses behavioural patterns, price elasticity & product experience in life
Churn / End of Life	Identifies root cause reasons for churn to feed future product/service investment
Performance Management	Delivers exceptional performance through effective KPI setting & management
Data Platform	Highly skilled at leading data platform design & build through agile methodology
Talent Development	Ensures the effective alignment of human capital with overall business strategy
People Management	Strong and decisive leadership of diverse multi-cultural cross functional teams
Hobbies: Family, Running, Travelling, and Music (inc playing the guitar)

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
Every position in a resume should have a job title.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'Skills'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
~~~~~~~~  
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  , Kilsby, Rugby, CV23 8XL
Email:    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  ;    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  


Accomplished Data and Analytics Leadership Professional
Visionary Leadership, Business Analytics, Data Science, Data Strategy,
Customer Journey, Talent Development, Experimentation & Agility


Matt is an accomplished and highly analytical Data and Analytics Leadership Professional with a wealth of understanding
and experience in leading all aspects of Data and Analytics from acquiring, organising, and storing data through to visualising
analytics, data science modelling and engaging with Executive teams to extract business learnings, run experiments and
prioritise future investments.

Career highlights include leading Skype's Data and Analytical capabilities, for 7 years, during its exponential growth phase,
IPO preparation and Microsoft Acquisition and then going on to set up a successful Data and Analytics consultancy business
which has provided solutions for a number of clients across the UK and ROW over recent years.

With a passion for working with Executive teams, to help learn and invest based on objective analytics, Matt is a polished
communicator and negotiator with natural authority. With an impressive record of combining customer analytics with
business insights Matt creates shared vision and aligns Data Strategy to corporate objectives offering an asset of high value
for the Board or Senior Management Team of any forward-thinking organisation.

Skills
Executive Leadership	Visionary leadership and skilled resource allocation to achieve all deliverables
Insights & Analytics	Highly skilled in directing data operations & customer analysis using analytical tools
Data Science	Develops predictive and prescriptive models powering business insights
Data Strategy	Defines and directs implementation of innovative and successful data strategies
Market Sizing	Expert in sizing market opportunities and headroom for growth potential
Client Acquisition	Builds marketing funnels and optimisation insights to maximise acquisition
Client Experience	Analyses behavioural patterns, price elasticity & product experience in life
Churn / End of Life	Identifies root cause reasons for churn to feed future product/service investment
Performance Management	Delivers exceptional performance through effective KPI setting & management
Data Platform	Highly skilled at leading data platform design & build through agile methodology
Talent Development	Ensures the effective alignment of human capital with overall business strategy
People Management	Strong and decisive leadership of diverse multi-cultural cross functional teams


Career Highlights

➢ Skype: led a team of 30 analysts, data scientists, data & dashboard engineers across the UK, US & India to provide
product & market intelligence to business leaders to help propel Skype to 1bn users & $8.5bn acquisition by Microsoft.
Specific responsibilities were centred around product experimentation, power BI dashboard roll out, data platform
architecture & build, deep learning and predictive data science modelling which were all channelled through an operating
rhythm and reporting structure which enabled business stakeholders to connect with insights and learnings.

➢ KNEIP: led a €3m euro investment (over 3 years) in upgrading KNEIP's, a financial services company in Luxembourg,
Data and Analytics capabilities as part of a broader strategy to transform the business to be a SaaS provider and improve
the company valuation by more than 10X. Specific responsibilities were to build and initially lead a BI team, tooling
capability (solved by Qlik) and lead market, customer and business analytics to gear the business for a new waive of
growth in an increasingly Digital Market.
➢ Boardroom Media: led a number of analytical projects for this Australian based Media Company to help extract
learnings from the current client base and shape future growth strategies. Specifically, projects included UK/US/APAC
market analysis, competitive positioning, pricing, marketing and optimisation of the acquisition funnel along with
customer engagement and churn triggers from within the existing client base.

➢ NW/A: led, as a Managing Partner and Deputy CEO of this Digital Investment and Transformation company, commercial
analysis on a number (25, in 4 years) of investment opportunities that led to the more than 10 investments, of ~£10m in
value, being secured predominantly the ESG, Food Tech or Media industries. Investments have been onwardly
supported with strategic input to help shape growth strategies and yield returns for the overall NW/A portfolio.

Career History

MJS BI Consulting Ltd - 2017 to Present Day


Following a brief period as Tandem Banks Chief Data Officer (which ended abruptly due to the business suffering a funding
collapse in 2017) a successful consultancy business was formed solving Data and Analytical needs for a number of clients
across the UK and ROW, highlights as follows;

KNEIP - a Financial Services business based in Luxembourg undertaking a Digital Transformation to be a
modern-day SaaS solution,

•	Led a €3m investment in building KNEIPs Data & Analytics capabilities as part of a full business SaaS transformation
•	Built, trained, & provided interim leadership to a BI Team of 1 Head of, 4 analysts and 2 Data Engineers
•	Deployed Qliksense as the business BI solution used by over 300 employees averaging 15 visits per month
•	Completed multiple analytical studies on KNEIPs client journey from acquisition to churn to identify and prioritise the
investment of a ~€30m Digital Transformation budget
•	Designed & embedded a reporting rhythm that put data at the heart of decision making with the C-suite/KNEIP Board
•	Embedded ESAT(Peakon) and NPS (Delighted) tooling as part of an agile way of working
•	Led analytics on product experimentation cycles to learn from a mixture of A/B and Time-Based testing and determine
product investment priorities.
•	Transformed the performance management culture from a once-a-year annual review cycle to an agile quarterly check
in which highly pivoted around data driven conversations - resulting in a dramatic shift on the performance bell curve.

that was ingesting 1 petabyte of data per day from the Skype user base
•	Business Analysis: Led analytical studies which changed Skypes investments in user experience; e.g. Skype's user
onboarding (200m users pa impacted) and Window migration (300m users impacted)
•   Microsoft Product Integration: ran predictive modelling/analysis to assess impact of Skypes integration to Microsoft's

•   Windows 10 Upgrade: ran significant A/B testing and predictive analytics to determine roll out and upgrade plan for
over 200m monthly users and 50m daily users on the Skype for Windows platform
•   Skype for Life: carried out extensive impact analysis/predictive modelling to top line KPIs, (Monthly Users, Calling

Head of Business Insights & Planning, Skype Operations (Jan 2010 - Mar 2013)

Built out a Business Insights and Planning capability, in the operational division of Skype, creating a data/metric led

British Telecom 2006 - 2010
